intro: Peperomia macrandra var. ampla, commonly known as the broad-leaf peperomia, is a compact, evergreen shrub native to tropical regions of South America. It features thick, waxy, ovate leaves that are often variegated with shades of green, white, and pink, adding visual interest to any setting. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers that appear in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in bright, indirect light and well-draining soil, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening. Its low maintenance and attractive foliage make it a versatile addition to both indoor and outdoor spaces.
